channel.title: No Alan Wake for the PC?
channel.description:
It seems it's definitive now.
[url]https://www.strategyinformer.com/news/6978/microsoft-alan-wake-will-no-longer-be-coming-to-the-pc[/url]
Appearantly an official Microsoft spokesperson said it's officialy not coming to the pc. According to the site it's an official statement. Most likely legit.
God I fucking hate Microsoft.

item.title: No Alan Wake for the PC?
item.dc:creator: Jeannotvb
item.description:
I remember those trailers a long time ago showing off the power of Intel quadcore CPU´s for this game, now they´re like hurr durr no moar PC lulz.

Read full topic

item.description:
Sad news, indeed. I was looking forward to it.

Read full topic
item.source: No Alan Wake for the PC?

item.title: No Alan Wake for the PC?
item.dc:creator: Hammich
item.description:
Maxey:

Max Payne 3 isn’t being developed by Remedy. It’s a complete Rockstar production now.

i know… i said that… but it’s remedy’s legacy… max payne as a character looks set to become lame… Alan Wake had so much potential as an RPG with thriller and horror elements, now it looks close to your standard horror/survival shooter and is console-only… died before he even got started…

both series are dead to me now… i still play the original max payne occasionally on an old pentium 3 though B)

Read full topic
item.source: No Alan Wake for the PC?

item.title: No Alan Wake for the PC?
item.dc:creator: Deutscher_Scharfschu
item.description:
Publishers make more from PC games than consoles when you compare per-unit profit. Microsoft likes the 360 more because they get more money from each copy sold when compared to the PC. For publishers, i think it’s the difference 15 dollars. When you multiply that by the number of total sold, that’s a lot of money that Microsoft makes.

The console war is over. Besides the PS3 slim, the three systems are pushing you to buy more titles, not the console itself. This applies to both exclusives as well as multi platformed games (I.E. MW2). The only way for the PC to get it’s crown back is for Microsoft to go over board and piss off the US government. Microsoft is too good a company to release the Iron grip it holds on the industry, after Digital distribution takes over for the next generation of consolers, it will only be Microsoft, Sony and Nintendo. That means that there will be no retailers to negotiate with.

All of this makes me sad. But alas, hopefully Valve stays true. Blizzard and ID are already leaning towards the console market, and it makes me sad. i hope that in the end we have more than MMOs and shitty ports to play.

Read full topic
item.source: No Alan Wake for the PC?

item.title: No Alan Wake for the PC?
item.dc:creator: JohnKiller118
item.description:
That’s still a major stretch. There are still plenty of good PC games coming out, albeit most of them are multiplatform. A few games aren’t going to change that.

Also, I love how people say “well, at least we still have Valve and Blizzard!” That’s just fucking sad.

Read full topic
item.source: No Alan Wake for the PC?

item.title: No Alan Wake for the PC?
item.dc:creator: CTID
item.description:
I wasn’t referring to just Alan Wake, though. The more games that shift from PC to an XBox 360 exclusive, the more people will have to buy XBoxes to play them.

Read full topic
item.source: No Alan Wake for the PC?

item.title: No Alan Wake for the PC?
item.dc:creator: JohnKiller118
item.description:
A person who spent hundreds or even thousands of dollars on a gaming PC isn’t going to jump ship just because of one game.

Sure, maybe a few people will get an XBox for this game, but imagine how much more Microsoft could be making if it was also on the PC.

But alas, Microsoft is retarded.

Read full topic
item.source: No Alan Wake for the PC?

item.title: No Alan Wake for the PC?
item.dc:creator: CTID
item.description:
Not if they can get people to buy more 360s.

Read full topic
item.source: No Alan Wake for the PC?

item.title: No Alan Wake for the PC?
item.dc:creator: NT78stonewobble
item.description:
I’ve got nothing against consoles per say but console only or lousy ports won’t be getting my money. Simple as that.

Personally I play fps, 3rdps, simulation and strategy games on my PC and the only console I’d consider is the wii for offering a very different gaming experience.

Now what I don’t get is why the hell microsoft wants console only games in any way. Wouldn’t they want as many reasons for people to go windows as possible?

Read full topic

between Alan Wake being console-only and rockstar turning max payne into a fatass bearded baldy with aviators and a beard… with remedy’s awesome legacy… i am weeping in despair whenever either series is mentioned

Max Payne 3 isn’t being developed by Remedy. It’s a complete Rockstar production now.

item.title: No Alan Wake for the PC?
item.dc:creator: Daedalus
item.description:
Soviet:

Correct me if I’m wrong, but a few years back when they first started talking about Alan Wake, wasn’t their main focus on how it was using quad core technology (a pc only thing) so impressively?

Yes. This makes it even more retarded.

Hazzmat:

Soo… at what realm do you play?

I stopped about one and a half year ago.
Played Stormreaver EU. But migrated to 2 other realms.
Was a holy paladin, hardcore raider but took too much time.
School and social life were destroyed. Had to stop.

Read full topic

item.description:
Daedalus:

Yeah I doubt it aswell. They’re not idiots, unlike Microsoft.

Cataclysm being console exclusive seems strangely very unlikely to me in the first place

Soo… at what realm do you play?

item.source: No Alan Wake for the PC?

item.title: No Alan Wake for the PC?
item.dc:creator: ShadowNate
item.description:
I was very excited about this new game by Remedy. It was supposed to mark the point for my next PC upgrade to a quad core… two years ago.

And then came the statements that the PC version’s chances are looking slim. That maybe we’ll see a PC version in the future but the focus has shifted to an XBOX exclusive release. And now this moronic excuse of a statement by an anonymous (?) spokesperson.

Right now I hate everything about the game. Just thinking about it is a heart-wrenching chore.

Read full topic
